intro: Tounatea subcoriacea, commonly known as the rough-stemmed tounatea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems covered in a rough, coriaceous texture. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy upper surface. Tounatea subcoriacea produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are often pink or red in color.
